title: Conserve Water in Desert Heat
brief: Use specific techniques to minimize water loss and maximize survival time in desert conditions.
steps: Step 1: Find shade immediately - get out of direct sun.
Step 2: Place something between you and the hot ground (sand can be 16-22Â°C hotter than air).
Step 3: Limit all movements to essential activities only.
Step 4: Wear complete uniform including T-shirt, roll sleeves down, cover head and neck.
Step 5: Stay fully clothed to absorb sweat and keep it against skin for maximum cooling effect.
Step 6: Stay quiet, avoid talking, keep mouth closed, breathe through nose.
Step 7: Do not eat if water is scarce - food digestion requires water.
warnings: Removing clothing in desert heat increases water loss and heat gain.
Ground temperature can reach 60Â°C (140Â°F) when air is 43Â°C (110Â°F).
Eating food without adequate water will accelerate dehydration.
